attributes.action: take action to meet the needs of mothers in prison and their children. The government should improve access to housing, support for family reunification and support for women offenders and their children.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is not a happy Mothers Day for mothers in prison or for their children.  

The government has recognised that most women in prison should not be there but must do more to fulfil its commitment to reducing the number of women who get sent to prison. 

The challenges faced by mothers in prison and their children do not end on release.  

All relevant government departments should work together to provide support to mothers leaving prison and to their children. This should include

a. safe, secure, stable housing for mothers leaving prison to enable them to live with their children

b. support for mothers in prison that starts in prison and is continued on release to help families to reintegrate 

c. information and training for people working with children (including in schools) about the support needs of children whose mothers are or have been in prison and guidance on working with mothers in prison and on release to give them and their children the support they need
